title: Defend Hobby Loss Audit
description: The IRS is auditing a client's Schedule C, claiming their activity is a hobby, not a business, because it has shown losses for several years.

tasks.description: Review the nine factors the IRS uses to distinguish a business from a hobby.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent understands the legal criteria for the audit.

tasks.description: Gather evidence demonstrating the client's business-like activity (e.g., business plan, separate bank accounts, time spent).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent compiles documentation to prove profit motive.

tasks.description: Prepare a written argument to the auditor explaining how the client's activity meets the criteria for a business.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent drafts a persuasive response to defend the client's position.
